sentences: Tee mis tahes, mitte ei jõua.
See on tõsi, rääkigu nad mis tahes.
Ostan selle maali mis tahes hinna eest.
context: 'tahes' is an Estonian adverb that forms indefinite expressions with words like 'ükskõik' (whoever, whatever) or other adverbs to indicate modification. It expresses the idea of 'no matter what', 'any kind of', or 'whatever'. It can be used in various constructions like 'mis tahes' (whatever), 'kes tahes' (whoever), 'millal tahes' (whenever), etc. The word is often paired with 'tahtmata' (unwillingly) to express inevitability, as in 'tahes või tahtmata' (willingly or unwillingly).
